intro: Fumaria officinalis subsp. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-floweredcelandine, is a member of the Papaveraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and dense clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its medicinal properties have historically been valued for their potential healing benefits.
